title: Google OAuth Login Success
description: Verify that a user can successfully log in using Google OAuth with valid credentials and that the first user is assigned the Admin role automatically.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Initiate Google OAuth login with a valid Google account.
Check that the backend verifies the ID token successfully.
Verify the user account is created or retrieved in the Turso database.
Confirm that if this is the first user, they are assigned the Admin role automatically.
Verify user is redirected to the dashboard page.
Validate activity log for login is recorded.

title: Google OAuth Login Failure with Invalid Token
description: Verify that login fails gracefully with invalid or expired Google ID token and appropriate error message is shown.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Attempt login with a manipulated or expired Google ID token.
Check backend rejects token with 401 status.
Verify user remains on the login page.
Verify appropriate error notification is shown to the user.

title: Role-Based Access Control Enforcement
description: Verify that actions are allowed or denied based on user roles for User, SQA, and Admin.

steps.description: Login as a User role account.
Attempt to edit issue status and priority.
Verify that access is denied for status and priority editing and UI controls are not visible.
Login as an SQA role account.
Attempt to edit issue status and priority.
Verify the edits are allowed and changes update correctly.
Login as an Admin role account.
Access user management UI and modify roles.
Verify that Admin can update user roles successfully.

title: Issue List Filtering, Searching and Pagination
description: Validate that issues can be filtered, searched, and paginated correctly on desktop and mobile layouts.

steps.description: Navigate to the Issues list page.
Apply filters for issue type, status, priority, and assignee.
Verify that the filtered results are displayed accordingly.
Use search input with various keywords and verify debounce functionality reduces API requests.
Confirm matching results update progressively.
Navigate through different pages using pagination.
Verify correct issues are shown for each page.
Switch to mobile layout and repeat filters, search, and pagination.
Check UI responsiveness and data correctness for mobile card view.
Verify URL query parameters update correctly with filter/search state and support sharing.

title: Issue Detail View Display and Inline Editing
description: Verify detailed issue view displays markdown descriptions, comments with badges, and activity timeline with auto-refresh; inline editing respects user roles.

steps.description: Open an issue detail page.
Verify issue description is rendered with markdown formatting.
Verify comments list shows badges for 'via Relay' or 'via Jira'.
Submit a new comment using Cmd+Enter.
Verify the comment is posted and displayed.
Verify activity timeline shows issue history like status changes and assignments.
Wait for 30 seconds with the tab visible.
Verify the issue details auto-refresh with latest data.
Login as SQA role and attempt to edit issue status and priority using dropdowns.
Confirm changes are saved successfully.
Login as User role and verify that status and priority dropdowns are not visible.

title: Issue Creation Form Validation and Submission
description: Verify the issue creation form performs real-time validation, supports rich text, file attachments, and submits data transformed according to Jira SQA template.

steps.description: Navigate to the create issue form.
Fill in the form fields with valid data including issue type, summary, description with rich text formatting, and upload one or more attachments.
Check that real-time validation indicates no errors.
Submit the form.
Verify issue is created successfully and visible in issue list.
Verify data sent to backend is transformed into Jira SQA template format.
Confirm attachments are uploaded and linked in the created issue.
Try submitting form with missing mandatory fields.
Verify validation errors are shown and submission is blocked.
Use large file attachments exceeding limits.
Verify upload is rejected with meaningful error.

title: Notification System Email and Discord
description: Verify notifications for issue events are sent via email and Discord respecting user preferences.

steps.description: Login and update notification preferences to enable email notifications and Discord notifications separately.
Trigger issue events like creation, status change, and comment addition.
Verify user receives email notifications according to preferences.
Verify Discord webhook notifications are sent correctly if enabled.
Turn off email and Discord notifications.
Trigger new issue events.
Confirm no notifications are sent when preferences are disabled.

title: Dashboard Display and Accuracy
description: Validate that the dashboard shows live metrics, charts, recent activities, and personalized stats accurately after login.

steps.description: Login to the system.
Verify dashboard displays user welcome message.
Verify key metrics such as open bugs, tasks, and system health status are displayed.
Check charts and recent activity feed display correct and updated information.
Perform issue modifications to trigger dashboard data changes.
Verify dashboard refreshes and updates metrics accordingly.

title: Polling Mechanism and Real-Time Updates
description: Validate recurring polling every 60 seconds fetches updated data, displays visual indicators, and pauses when browser tab is inactive.

steps.description: Login and open issues list or issue detail page.
Observe that polling requests occur approximately every 60 seconds.
Make a change on the backend or via another client.
Verify visual indicators notify user of new data available.
Switch browser tab to inactive (background).
Verify polling pauses when tab is inactive.
Return to active tab.
Verify polling resumes and updates data.
Simulate polling failure.
Verify error handling displays appropriate messages or retries.

title: User Preferences for Theme and Notifications Persistency
description: Validate that user preferences such as theme (light/dark/system) and notification toggles are saved, loaded from backend, and applied correctly.

steps.description: Login and open user preferences settings.
Change theme preference to dark mode.
Verify UI theme updates accordingly.
Change notification toggles for email and Discord.
Verify preferences are sent and saved to the backend.
Logout and login again.
Verify preferences are loaded from backend and applied correctly on page load.

title: SPA Navigation Without React Router
description: Verify that SPA navigation using native history API updates URL and content correctly without full page reloads.

steps.description: Login and navigate through different pages using the navigation bar.
Verify content updates without full page reload.
Check the browser URL reflects current page with correct pathname.
Use browser back and forward buttons.
Verify popstate events update content accordingly.

title: Error Boundary Handling
description: Verify React error boundaries catch exceptions and display fallback UI instead of crashing the app.

steps.description: Simulate an error in a child component by throwing an exception.
Verify error boundary catches the error.
Verify fallback UI is rendered with a meaningful message.
Trigger async loading state in a component.
Verify loading component displays appropriately.

title: Logout Functionality and Activity Logging
description: Verify users can log out securely and that the logout event is logged in the activity log.

steps.description: Login successfully.
Click sign out button in the navigation bar.
Verify user is redirected to login page.
Verify session is cleared and no protected pages are accessible.
Check backend activity log.
Verify logout event is recorded with timestamp and user details.

title: Backend Environment Variables and Service Initialization
description: Verify that all required environment variables are loaded correctly and services initialize properly at backend startup.

steps.description: Start backend server with all environment variables set correctly.
Verify server starts successfully without errors.
Start backend server with one or more environment variables missing or misconfigured.
Verify startup fails gracefully with logged error messages.

title: Performance Under Load With 80 Daily Users
description: Verify system performance and stability under load simulating 80 concurrent daily users with real-time syncing and polling.

steps.description: Simulate 80 concurrent users performing login, issue creation, editing, and polling actions.
Verify no significant degradation in response times.
Validate real-time syncing remains accurate and timely.
Verify no crashes, errors, or data inconsistencies occur.
